results.title: Utility of support vector machine and decision tree to identify the prognosis of metformin poisoning in the United States: analysis of National Poisoning Data System
results.text_hl: In line with other studies, we also showed that @DISEASE_Acidosis @DISEASE_MESH:D000138 @@@acidosis@@@, @DISEASE_Hypoglycemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007003 @@@hypoglycemia@@@, @DISEASE_Water_Electrolyte_Imbalance @DISEASE_MESH:D014883 @@@electrolyte abnormality@@@, @DISEASE_Hypotension @DISEASE_MESH:D007022 @@@hypotension@@@, elevated anion gap, elevated @CHEMICAL_Creatinine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003404 @@@creatinine@@@, @DISEASE_Tachycardia @DISEASE_MESH:D013610 @@@tachycardia@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D051437 @@@renal failure@@@, age, and unintentional exposure to @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ are the determinants of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ @DISEASE_Poisoning @DISEASE_MESH:D011041 @@@poisoning@@@ prognosis.

citations.NLM: Mehrpour O, Saeedi F, Hoyte C, Goss F, Shirazi FM. Utility of support vector machine and decision tree to identify the prognosis of metformin poisoning in the United States: analysis of National Poisoning Data System BMC Pharmacol Toxicol. 2022 Jul 13;23(1):49. PMID: 35831909

results.title: Metformin-Cimetidine Drug Interaction and Risk of Lactic Acidosis in Renal Failure: A Pharmacovigilance-Pharmacokinetic Appraisal.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: Following the 2016 Food and Drug Administration @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ approval for mild-to-moderate @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D051437 @@@RF@@@, the percentage of patients with @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D051437 @@@RF@@@ reporting @DISEASE_Acidosis_Lactic @DISEASE_MESH:D000140 @@@LA@@@ associated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ combined with H2RI increased.

citations.NLM: Xie W, Li J, Kong C, Luo W, Zheng J, Zhou Y. Metformin-Cimetidine Drug Interaction and Risk of Lactic Acidosis in Renal Failure: A Pharmacovigilance-Pharmacokinetic Appraisal. Diabetes Care. 2023 Nov 10;():. PMID: 37948503

results.title: A Comparative Study of Acidosis in Diabetic Advanced Chronic Kidney Disease Patients on and off Metformin
results.text_hl: @DISEASE_Acidosis_Lactic @DISEASE_MESH:D000140 @@@MALA@@@ occurs in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ taking @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ who have @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D051437 @@@renal failure@@@.

results.title: Postintervention Effects of Varying Treatment Arms on Glycemic Failure and beta-Cell Function in the TODAY Trial.
results.text_hl: OBJECTIVE: The Treatment Options for @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@type 2 Diabetes@@@ in Adolescents and Youth (TODAY) trial demonstrated that @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D051437 @@@glycemic failure@@@ rates were significantly lower in youth randomized to @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ plus @CHEMICAL_Rosiglitazone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077154 @@@rosiglitazone@@@ treatment than in youth randomized to @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ alone or @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ plus intensive lifestyle intervention.

citations.NLM: TODAY Study Group. Postintervention Effects of Varying Treatment Arms on Glycemic Failure and beta-Cell Function in the TODAY Trial. Diabetes Care. 2021 Jan;44(1):75-80. PMID: 33290248
citations.BibTeX: @article{33290248, title={Postintervention Effects of Varying Treatment Arms on Glycemic Failure and beta-Cell Function in the TODAY Trial.}, author={TODAY Study Group}, journal={Diabetes Care}, volume={44}, number={1}, pages={75-80}}

results.title: The Current and Potential Therapeutic Use of Metformin:The Good Old Drug
results.text_hl: This paper presents some arguments supporting the initiation of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with newly diagnosed @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@T2DM@@@, especially those without cardiovascular risk factors or without established @DISEASE_Cardiovascular_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D002318 @@@cardiovascular disease@@@ or advanced @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D051437 @@@kidney insufficiency@@@ at the time of new guidelines favoring new drugs with pleotropic effects complimentary to @CHEMICAL_Glucose @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005947 @@@glucose@@@ control.

citations.NLM: Drzewoski J, Hanefeld M. The Current and Potential Therapeutic Use of Metformin:The Good Old Drug Pharmaceuticals (Basel). 2021 Feb 5;14(2):. PMID: 33562458
citations.BibTeX: @article{33562458, title={The Current and Potential Therapeutic Use of Metformin:The Good Old Drug}, author={Drzewoski J and Hanefeld M}, journal={Pharmaceuticals (Basel)}, volume={14}, number={2}}

results.title: Metformin: the updated protective property in kidney disease
results.text_hl: Furthermore, the United States Food and Drug Administration declared @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ is safe for @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with mild or moderate @DISEASE_Kidney_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D007674 @@@kidney impairment@@@ in 2016, assuaging some conservative attitudes about @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ management in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D051437 @@@renal insufficiency@@@ and broadening the scope of research on the renal protective effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@.

citations.NLM: Pan Q, Lu X, Zhao C, Liao S, Chen X, Guo F, Yang C, Liu HF. Metformin: the updated protective property in kidney disease Aging (Albany NY). 2020 May 1;12(9):8742-8759. PMID: 32364526
citations.BibTeX: @article{32364526, title={Metformin: the updated protective property in kidney disease}, author={Pan Q and Lu X and Zhao C and Liao S and Chen X and Guo F and Yang C and Liu HF}, journal={Aging (Albany NY)}, volume={12}, number={9}, pages={8742-8759}}

results.title: Metformin-Associated Lactic Acidosis: A Case Report.
results.text_hl: ...Introduction: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ is considered a first-line therapy for patients with @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes@@@ secondary to its cost efficiency, minimal side effects, and marked improvement in one's hemoglobin A1c; however, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ is avoided in patients with @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D051437 @@@renal insufficiency@@@ out of concern for drug accumulation and @DISEASE_Acidosis_Lactic @DISEASE_MESH:D000140 @@@lactic acidosis@@@.

citations.NLM: Santoli J, Aldakkour JL, Tohidi H, Lin Y. Metformin-Associated Lactic Acidosis: A Case Report. HCA Healthc J Med. 2023;4(2):215-218. PMID: 37424987

results.title: Reversible Total Vision Loss Caused by Severe Metformin-associated Lactic Acidosis: A Case Report
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@-associated @DISEASE_Acidosis_Lactic @DISEASE_MESH:D000140 @@@lactic acidosis@@@ (@DISEASE_Acidosis_Lactic @DISEASE_MESH:D000140 @@@MALA@@@) carries a high mortality and can occur in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D051437 @@@renal failure@@@ from drug bioaccumulation.

citations.NLM: Koons A, Amaducci AM, Katz KD. Reversible Total Vision Loss Caused by Severe Metformin-associated Lactic Acidosis: A Case Report Clin Pract Cases Emerg Med. 2021 May;5(2):206-209. PMID: 34437006

results.title: Reduced lactic acidosis risk with Imeglimin: Comparison with Metformin
results.text_hl: @SPECIES_10116 @@@Rats@@@ with @CHEMICAL_Gentamicins @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005839 @@@gentamycin@@@-induced @<m>DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D051437 @@@renal insufficiency@@@ received @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ or @CHEMICAL_imeglimin @CHEMICAL_MESH:C575881 @@@Imeglimin@@@ (50-100 mg/kg/h), only @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ increased lactatemia and @CHEMICAL_Hydrogen @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006859 @@@H+@@@ concentrations with mortality at higher doses.
